Submodules

Morelia.Stream.data_flow module

Stream data from multiple devices to multiple destinations. In technical terms, this module is used to create bipartite dataflow graphs from devices to data sinks.

class Morelia.Stream.data_flow.DataFlow(network: list[tuple[AquisitionDevice, list[SinkInterface]]])

Bases: object

Class that use multiprocessing to efficiently collect data from many devices at once.

Parameters:

  • network (list[tuple[:class: Pod8206HR | :class: Pod8401HR | :class: Pod8274D, list[ :class: SinkInterface]]]) – A mapping of data sources (POD devices) to one or more data sinks.

  • filter_method (FilterMethod, optional) – Method to use to clean curropted data. Defaults to TAKE_PAST.

  • filter_insert_value (float, optional) – Value to insert when using the INSERT filter method. Defaults to NaN.

  • fail_tolerance (int, optional) – How many times in a row to fail reading before giving up on reading a “chunk” of data (“chunk” here is approximately 1 second of samples). Defaults to 3.

collect() → None

Collect until stop_collection is called.

collect_for_seconds(duration_sec: float) → None

Collect data for duration_sec seconds.

Parameters:

duration_sec (float) – How long to collect data for in seconds.

stop_collection() → None

Stop collecting data.

Morelia.Stream.source module

Functions for getting streaming data from a POD device.

Morelia.Stream.source.get_data(duration: float, manual_stop_event: Event, pod: AquisitionDevice, sinks) → None

Streams data from the POD device. The data drops about every 1 second. Streaming will continue until a “stop streaming” packet is recieved.

Args:

fail_tolerance (int): The number of successive failed attempts of reading data before stopping the streaming.
